member.name: F:IronPdf.ChromeHttpLoginCredentials.CustomPostFiles
member.summary:
Optional, Advanced Usage: Specifies a collection files to summited on every PDF rendering request. Allows images and documents to be submitted to forms such that the output will be rendered as an PDF.
Note: The Key is the name of the post field, The value is the full file path.. UrlEncoding is not required.

member.name: F:IronPdf.ChromeHttpLoginCredentials.CustomPostVariables
member.summary:
Optional: Specifies a collection of HTTP 'POST' variables to submit on every PDF rendering request.
Note: The 'key' is the name of the post field, The 'value' is its value. UrlEncoding is not required.

member.name: P:IronPdf.ChromePdfRenderOptions.GenerateUniqueDocumentIdentifiers
member.summary:
Set to false if you wish to use binary file equality to compare PDFs such as for Unit Tests.
if false, is not generated inside PDF DOM (better for unit testing) and of two identical PDF files is the same.
If true, is generated inside PDF DOM (better for security) and of two identical PDF files differs.
Default value is false.

member.name: P:IronPdf.ChromePdfRenderOptions.ViewPortHeight
member.summary:
Defines a virtual screen height used to render HTML to PDF in IronPdf. Measured in pixels.
Viewport size is important in modern responsive HTML5 + CSS3 websites (e.g. Bootstrap framework websites) because the rendering and order of elements on the screen is dependent on viewport size.
The default viewport is 1280px wide by 1024px high to ensure the desktop version of a website is rendered unless otherwise specified. Smaller sizes (particularly width) will render responsive versions of many websites.

member.name: P:IronPdf.ChromePdfRenderOptions.ViewPortWidth
member.summary:
Defines a virtual screen width used to render HTML to PDF in IronPdf. Measured in pixels.
Viewport size is important in modern responsive HTML5 + CSS3 websites (e.g. Bootstrap framework websites) because the rendering and order of elements on the screen is dependent on viewport size.
The default viewport is 1280px wide by 1024px high to ensure the desktop version of a website is rendered unless otherwise specified. Smaller sizes (particularly width) will render responsive versions of many website

member.summary:
Do nothing.
Default Chrome PDF printing behavior. Uses to specify zoom level.
has no effect. Instead, Chrome will automatically set the view port based on . Use to specify CSS media style.
member.remarks: Useful when using 'print' CSS media style or printing documents to match the Chrome browser print preview.

member.name: F:IronPdf.Engines.Chrome.FitToPaperModes.FixedPixelWidth
member.summary:
Fit an exact number of pixels onto each PDF page.
Uses to specify the pixel width to fit on each PDF page.
has no effect. Instead, IronPdf will calculate the zoom level based on and
member.remarks: Useful when an optimal pixel width is known or printing documents to match a Chrome browser window display

member.name: F:IronPdf.Engines.Chrome.FitToPaperModes.Automatic
member.summary:
Measures minimum HTML content width after it is rendered by the browser and calculates based on the width of the content.
and have no effect and are calculated automatically by IronPdf.
member.remarks: Useful when fitting a wide content or content of unknown width onto a PDF page

member.name: F:IronPdf.Engines.Chrome.FitToPaperModes.AutomaticFit
member.summary:
Measures minimum HTML content width after it is rendered by the browser using the smallest view port possible, and calculates based on the width of the content.
Use to specify the minimum number of pixels to be fit on each PDF page.
has no effect and is calculated automatically by IronPdf.
member.remarks: Useful when fitting smaller content onto a wide page

member.name: T:IronPdf.HtmlHeaderFooter
P:IronPdf.HtmlHeaderFooter.BaseUrl
member.summary:
The Base URL all URLS in the HtmlFragment will be relative to. This includes 'src' attributes on images, scripts, style-sheets and also hrefs on hyper-links.
Note: A base URL that points to a directory should end with a slash.
Base URL accepts file paths as well as URLS. If no BaseUrl is given, the HtmlHeaderFooter BaseUrl will be inherited from the main HTML document where possible.

member.name: P:IronPdf.HtmlHeaderFooter.MaxHeight
member.summary: Maximum Height of the Html Header / Footer in millimeters. This value must be set sufficiently high to display the full html header / footer content.

member.name: P:IronPdf.HtmlHeaderFooter.HtmlFragment
member.summary: The Html which will be use to render the Header / Footer. Should be an HTML snippet rather than a complete document. May contain styles & images. Merge meta-data into the HtmlFragment by putting any of these placeholder strings into the text: {page} {total-pages} {url} {date} {time} {html-title} {pdf-title}. An alternative mail-merge style using the pattern also workd HtmlFragment is a stand alone HTML document which does not inherit styles or settings from your main HTML content unless is set true

member.name: P:IronPdf.HtmlHeaderFooter.LoadStylesAndCSSFromMainHtmlDocument
member.summary:
Loads style code blocks and links to CSS style sheets from the main HTML document (which provides the PDF content) into the .
By default, Html Headers and Footers are stand- alone HTML documents with their own default styles. Setting to true will attempt to load all STYLE and LINK tags from the main HTML document (which renders teh PDF) into the .
If your main HTML document contains complex CSS frameworks, styles the HEAD or BODY element heavily or loads CSS from javascript then this method may not work as intended.
This feature is not available for RenderUrlAsPdf methods. It works for RenderHtmlAsPdf, HTMLToPdf and HtmlFileToPdf conversions only.
It is often preferable to load style sheets explicitly into your HTML Headers and Footers as STYLE and LINK tags within the for granular control

member.name: M:IronPdf.HtmlHeaderFooter.Clone
member.summary: Supports . Creates a deep copy of this class instance.
member.returns: A deep clone of this instance. Use explicit casting to convert object back to the intended type.

member.name: T:IronPdf.ImageToPdfConverter
member.summary:
The ImageToPdfConveter class can be used to create PDF documents from images. It accepts both image files and objects as input.
The ImageToPdf static methods create simple PDF documents containing each image as one page of the created PDF.
To rasterize PDF documents as images (the reverse operation), see and

member.name: M:IronPdf.ImageToPdfConverter.ImageToPdf(System.String,IronPdf.Imaging.ImageBehavior)
member.summary: Converts a single image file to an identical PDF document of matching dimensions. The default PaperSize is A4. You can set it via ImageToPdfConverter.PaperSize. Note: Imaging.ImageBehavior.CropPage will set PaperSize equal to ImageSize.
member.param: File path of the image file.
Describes how image should be placed on the PDF page
member.returns: Returns a document which can then be edited, saved or served over the web.
member.exception: The file does not have a supported image format. Supported files: .apng, .avif, .bmp, .cur, .dib, .gif, .ico, .jfif, .jif, .jpe, .jpeg, .jpg, .pjp, .pjpeg, .png, .svg, .tif, .tiff, .webp

member.name: M:IronPdf.ImageToPdfConverter.ImageToPdf(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String},IronPdf.Imaging.ImageBehavior)
member.summary: Converts multiple image files to a PDF document. Each image creates 1 page which matches the image dimensions. The default PaperSize is A4. You can set it via ImageToPdfConverter.PaperSize. Note: Imaging.ImageBehavior.CropPage will set PaperSize equal to ImageSize.
member.param: The image file path names.
Describes how image should be placed on the PDF page

member.name: F:IronPdf.Installation.LinuxAndDockerDependenciesAutoConfig
member.summary:
If true The necessary package dependencies for IronPDf rendering will we automatically installed to Docker and Debian / Ubuntu Linux deployments.
Applies only to IronPDF for .Net Core.
This will take a few minutes the next time you run IronPDF. Watch the Visual Studio "Output" window for progress.
Set this to false if manual Docker / Linux setup is more convenient: https://ironpdf.com/docs/questions/docker-linux/

member.name: F:IronPdf.Installation.SendAnonymousAnalyticsAndCrashData
member.summary:
Opt in or out of sending anonymous usage statistics about IronPdf usage and performance to help us improve the product and developer experience.
Usage statistics are never sent in commercially deployed projects (when a license key is applied), only during development usage.

Renders page footers to an existing PDF File
Margin spacing on the PDF page for the footer are set to default values of 25mm. An overload method allow footer margins to be chosen specifically or set to zero.

Optional. The number of first page.

member.returns: Returns this PdfDocument object, allowing for a 'fluent' (LINQ like) chained in-line code style

member.name: M:IronPdf.PdfDocument.ToBitmap(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Rasterizes (renders) the PDF into System.Drawing.Bitmap objects. 1 Bitmap for each page.
Please add an assembly reference to System.Drawing to use this "PDF To Image" method.
Please Dispose() each Bitmap object after use.
member.param: The resolution of the output Bitmap in 'Dots Per Inch'. Higher DPI creates larger bitmap files of higher image quality.
member.returns: An array of System.Drawing.Bitmap image objects which can be saved, manipulated, displayed or edited programmatically.
member.remarks: The may be ignored on some Linux distros.

member.name: M:IronPdf.PdfDocument.ToBitmap(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Int32},System.Int32)
member.summary:
Rasterizes (renders) the PDF into System.Drawing.Bitmap objects.
Specific pages may be selected using the PageIndexes parameter.
Please add an assembly reference to System.Drawing to use this "PDF To Image" method
Please Dispose() each Bitmap object after use.
member.param: Specific zero based page index may be given to only convert part of the PDF document to images
The desired resolution of the output Images.
member.returns: An array of System.Drawing.Bitmap image objects which can be saved, manipulated, displayed or edited programmatically.
member.remarks: The will be ignored under Linux and macOS.

The target maximum height(in pixel) of the output images.

Renders the PDF and exports image Files in convenient formats. 1 image file is created for each page.
FileNamePattern should normally contain an asterisk (*) character which will be substituted for the page numbers

The desired resolution of the output Images.
member.returns: An array of the file paths of the image files created.

member.name: M:IronPdf.PdfDocument.WatermarkAllPages(System.String,IronPdf.Editing.WaterMarkLocation,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary:
Watermarks all pages of this PDF with HTML content.
Watermarks are restricted to basic positioning and a 100mm by 100mm maximum size.
member.param: The HTML fragment
The location of the watermark.
The opacity of the watermark from 0-100%. 100 is opaque, 0 is invisible.
The rotation of the watermark content in clockwise degrees.
An optional hyperlink which the watermark will link to.
member.returns: Returns this PdfDocument object, allowing for a 'fluent' (LINQ like) chained in-line code style

Watermarks are restricted to basic positioning and a 100mm by 100mm maximum size.

member.name: T:IronPdf.License
member.summary: Allows IronPdf license keys to be applied globally across an application.

member.name: F:IronPdf.License.LicenseKey
member.summary:
Removes watermarks. Get Licensed at https://ironpdf.com/licensing
For .Net framework applications, a license key can alternatively be added to Web.Config or App.Config XML file using <add key="IronPdf.LicenseKey" value="IRONPDF-LICENSE-KEY"/> within the appSettings tag. See https://ironpdf.com/docs/license/license-keys/
For .Net Core applications, a license key may be added to appsettings.json where the key name is "IronPdf.LicenseKey" and the value is a valid IronPDF trial or full license key.
See https://ironpdf.com/licensing/ for licensing options.

member.name: M:IronPdf.License.IsValidLicense(System.String)
member.summary:
Determines whether a string license key is valid.
See https://ironpdf.com/licensing/ for trial, development and commercial deployment licensing options.
member.param: IronPDF license key as a string
member.returns: True if the license key given is valid.

member.name: P:IronPdf.License.IsLicensed
member.summary:
Determines whether this instance of IronPDF is Licensed.
Will return false unless a is set to a valid trial or full license key in IronPdf.License.LicenseKey, Web.Config , App.Config or appsettings.json in .Net Core.
See https://ironpdf.com/licensing/ and https://ironpdf.com/docs/license/license-keys/
member.returns: True if the license key given is valid.

member.name: T:IronPdf.Security.PdfSecuritySettings
member.summary:
A class defining user security settings for a PDF document.
Allows the developer to control user access passwords, encryption, and also who may edit, print and copy content from the PDF document
Implemented in .

member.name: M:IronPdf.Security.PdfSecuritySettings.MakePdfDocumentReadOnly(System.String)
member.summary:
Makes this PDF document read only such that:
Content is encrypted at 128 bit. Copy and paste of content is disallowed. Annotations and form editing are disabled.
member.param: The owner password for the PDF. A string for owner password is required to enable PDF encryption and all document security options.

member.name: M:IronPdf.Security.PdfSecuritySettings.RemovePasswordsAndEncryption
member.summary:
Removes all user and owner password security for a PDF document. Also disables content encryption.
Content is encrypted at 128 bit. Copy and paste of content is disallowed. Annotations and form editing are disabled.

member.name: P:IronPdf.Security.PdfSecuritySettings.AllowUserAnnotations
member.summary:
Gets or sets the permissions for users to annotate the PDF document with comments.
If AllowUserAnnotations is set false, the must be set for the security measure to take effect.
member.value: true if users may annotate the PDF document, otherwise false.

member.name: P:IronPdf.Security.PdfSecuritySettings.AllowUserCopyPasteContent
member.summary:
Gets or sets the permissions for users to extract or 'copy & paste' content (text and images) from the PDF document.
If AllowUserCopyPasteContent is set false, the must also be set for the security measure to take effect.
member.value: true if users may 'copy and paste' content out of the PDF otherwise, false.

member.name: P:IronPdf.Security.PdfSecuritySettings.AllowUserCopyPasteContentForAccessibility
member.summary: Gets or sets the permissions for users to extract or 'copy & paste' content (text and images) from the PDF document for accessibility.
member.value: true if users may 'copy and paste' content out of the PDF otherwise, false.

member.name: P:IronPdf.Security.PdfSecuritySettings.AllowUserEdits
member.summary:
Gets or sets the permissions for users edit the PDF document. The features to edit the document depends entirely on the PDF client software used by the end user.
If editing rights are restricted, then the must be set for the security measure to take effect.
member.value: The value for user edit security.

member.name: P:IronPdf.Security.PdfSecuritySettings.AllowUserFormData
member.summary:
Gets or sets the permissions for users to fill-in (enter data into) forms in the PDF document.
If AllowUserFormData is set false, the must be set for the security measure to take effect.
Note. If you want to make the form readonly in Adobe Acrobat Reader please call method or set to and set .
member.value: true if users may annotate the PDF document, otherwise false. Setting AllowUserFormData true will also enable annotations.

member.name: P:IronPdf.Security.PdfSecuritySettings.AllowUserPrinting
member.summary:
Gets or sets the permissions for users to print the PDF document.
If print rights are restricted, then the must be set for the security measure to take effect.
member.value: The value for user printing.

member.name: P:IronPdf.Security.PdfSecuritySettings.OwnerPassword
member.summary:
Sets the owner password and enables 128Bit encryption of PDF content. An owner password is one used to enable and disable all other security settings.
OwnerPassword must be set to a non empty string value for , , ,s and to be restricted.

member.name: P:IronPdf.Security.PdfSecuritySettings.UserPassword
member.summary:
Sets the user password and enables 128Bit encryption of PDF content .
A user password if a password that each user must enter to open or print the PDF document.
